conclusion: To find the power of the external force doing work, let's go through the problem step by step.
The EMF generated in the rotating conductor rod OC due to its motion in the magnetic field can be calculated using Faraday's law of electromagnetic induction.
The induced EMF is calculated as \( \mathcal{E} = B \cdot r^2 \cdot \omega \).
The current I flowing through the resistor R is \( I = \frac{B \cdot r^2 \cdot \omega}{R} \).
The power P dissipated in the resistor R is \( P = \frac{B^2 \cdot r^4 \cdot \omega^2}{R} \).
The power of the external force doing work must equal the power dissipated in the resistor.
The power of the external force doing work is \( \frac{B^2 \cdot r^4 \cdot \omega^2}{R} \).
